meta.description: Text Transformation Prompt Stack - Two-stack architecture for intelligent audio transcription editing

architecture.foundational: Universal baseline corrections applied to all transcriptions. These layers represent editing that is almost always desirable.
architecture.stylistic: Context-specific formatting and style adjustments. Select appropriate layers based on output requirements.

foundational.description: Foundational layers are applied in order (01-05) and represent universally desirable transcription cleanup. These go beyond verbatim transcription to produce polished, publication-ready text.
foundational.usage: Always applied as a complete stack. All layers work together to transform raw audio into clean text.

layers.name: Context
layers.description: Establishes the transcription task and model role

layers.name: Exclusions
layers.description: Content to exclude entirely from the transcription

layers.name: Corrections
layers.description: Fixes and modifications to apply to remaining content

stylistic.description: Stylistic layers customize output format, tone, and style. Select appropriate layers based on the desired output characteristics.
stylistic.usage: Select one from each category as needed. These layers are applied after the foundational stack.

layers.name: Format Adherence
layers.usage: Select one - choose exactly one format per stack

elements.name: email
elements.instruction: Format the text as a professional email with appropriate greeting and closing.

elements.name: documentation
elements.instruction: Format the text as technical documentation with clear sections and structure.

elements.name: todo-list
elements.instruction: Structure the text as a to-do list with actionable items.

elements.name: task-list
elements.instruction: Convert the text into a structured task list with clear deliverables.

elements.name: freeform-text
elements.instruction: Present the text as freeform prose without specific structural constraints.

layers.name: Tone
layers.usage: Select one - choose exactly one tone per stack

elements.name: maximum-formality
elements.instruction: Apply maximum formality to the text, using formal language and structure.

elements.name: business-appropriate
elements.instruction: Ensure the tone is business-appropriate and professional.

elements.name: minimum-formality
elements.instruction: Apply minimum formality to the text, using casual and relaxed language.

elements.name: informal-interpersonal
elements.instruction: Use an informal tone suitable for interpersonal communication.

layers.name: Emotional
layers.usage: Select one - choose exactly one emotional register per stack

elements.name: heightened-emotion
elements.instruction: Increase the emotional intensity and expressiveness of the text.

elements.name: neutral-emotion
elements.instruction: Maintain neutral emotional tone throughout the text.

elements.name: low-emotion
elements.instruction: Reduce emotional language and maintain a restrained tone.

layers.name: Writing Style
layers.usage: Select one or more - can select multiple compatible style modifiers

elements.name: concise
elements.instruction: Make the text concise by removing unnecessary words while preserving meaning.

elements.name: verbose
elements.instruction: Expand the text with additional detail and explanation.

elements.name: technical
elements.instruction: Apply technical language and precise terminology appropriate to the subject.

elements.name: conversational
elements.instruction: Rewrite the text in a conversational, natural speaking style.

layers.name: Readability
layers.usage: Select one - choose exactly one readability level per stack

elements.name: simple
elements.instruction: Simplify the text for easy comprehension by general audiences.

elements.name: intermediate
elements.instruction: Adjust the text to an intermediate readability level suitable for educated readers.

elements.name: advanced
elements.instruction: Increase complexity and sophistication for expert-level readers.
